cells.labelText: Task 1 – Battery Disconnection
Task 1 – Battery Disconnection
Task 1 – Battery Disconnection
Task 1 – Battery Disconnection
Task 1 – Battery Disconnection
Task 1 – Battery Disconnection
Sub-Step (What)
Highlight/Key Point (How)
Visual Support
Sign Off
Sign on to permit of isolation and lock on.

Inspect Locomotive entry points.
Ensure Roads are locked out and the Locomotive isolated. (Locomotive can be moved or other rolling stock can enter work area)
Ensure that safe working protection is in place. 
Refer to Isolation matrix for lockout points.
Ensure entry walkways are properly secured with straps, and barriers are across any gaps. (Falling down to the pit can occur)
Sign Off
Sign on to permit of isolation and lock on.

Inspect Locomotive entry points.
Ensure Roads are locked out and the Locomotive isolated. (Locomotive can be moved or other rolling stock can enter work area)
Ensure that safe working protection is in place. 
Refer to Isolation matrix for lockout points.
Ensure entry walkways are properly secured with straps, and barriers are across any gaps. (Falling down to the pit can occur)
Location: Step 1 over pit area
Sign on to permit of isolation and lock on.

Inspect Locomotive entry points.
Ensure Roads are locked out and the Locomotive isolated. (Locomotive can be moved or other rolling stock can enter work area)
Ensure that safe working protection is in place. 
Refer to Isolation matrix for lockout points.
Ensure entry walkways are properly secured with straps, and barriers are across any gaps. (Falling down to the pit can occur)

Take Note:
Ask your Permit Isolation Officer or Administrator if unsure of isolation.  
Trips and falls can occur whilst boarding Locomotive, unwanted movement of walkways can occur
Location: Step 1 over pit area

cells.labelText: Preparation – Mandatory

TASK OVERVIEW:  
This WMS provides the step by step procedure for the disconnection and reconnection of the locomotive batteries.
Each step MUST be followed in order to safely and efficiently complete the task.
Each step is outlined clearly in the Task section of this document.

TASK OVERVIEW:  
This WMS provides the step by step procedure for the disconnection and reconnection of the locomotive batteries.
Each step MUST be followed in order to safely and efficiently complete the task.
Each step is outlined clearly in the Task section of this document.

Components:
Materials:
Platform ladder/ mobile platform
Container to store nuts, bolts, and washers
 
Tools & Equipment:
Battery rattle gun
deep 19mm impact socket
Gloves
Safety glasses
2 x ½ inch geared spanners
300mm cable ties
Hearing protection

cells.labelText: Flick all breakers off and Pull knife switches.

Once the loco has come into the shed and is still under the driver’s possession, confirm the polarity of the BCCB circuit breaker (Dash 9 only). Attach an information tag to the circuit breaker with the relevant information confirming if the polarity is correct or incorrect. Then turn all breakers on the ECP panel off and pull both knife switches to the disconnect position.
Electrician

Once the loco has come into the shed and is still under the driver’s possession, confirm the polarity of the BCCB circuit breaker (Dash 9 only). Attach an information tag to the circuit breaker with the relevant information confirming if the polarity is correct or incorrect. Then turn all breakers on the ECP panel off and pull both knife switches to the disconnect position.
Location:

Attach an information tag to the circuit breaker with the relevant information confirming if the polarity is correct or incorrect. Then turn all breakers on the ECP panel off and pull both knife switches to the disconnect position.

Take Note: 
Complete a Take 5 for confirming the polarity of the BCCB Circuit breaker.

Sub-Step (What)
Highlight/Key Point (How)
Visual Support
Sign Off
Use a calibrated and proven voltage tester to test between either side of the diode as shown and earth.

The capacitor MUST be checked at this stage for voltage.  
Whether or not voltage is present turn the BCCB breaker in the ECP panel ON to dissipate any energy from the capacitor.

Re-test the capacitor to ensure it has no voltage 

Place info tag on the BCCB breaker stating the breaker should be left on to ensure the capacitor remains discharged.
Electrician

The capacitor MUST be checked at this stage for voltage.  
Whether or not voltage is present turn the BCCB breaker in the ECP panel ON to dissipate any energy from the capacitor.

Re-test the capacitor to ensure it has no voltage 

Place info tag on the BCCB breaker stating the breaker should be left on to ensure the capacitor remains discharged.
Location:

Re-test the capacitor to ensure it has no voltage 

Place info tag on the BCCB breaker stating the breaker should be left on to ensure the capacitor remains discharged.
Take Note:

Place personal lock on the hasp that is securing the knife switch door.

Master lock should already be attached to hasp, securing knife switch door closed. (To eliminate the risk of there being a load on any circuits when batteries are connected, which could cause an arc flash)

cells.labelText: Using the battery rattle gun and 19mm socket, remove 12 nuts and washers per panel.

Remove nuts, starting from the bottom row, working your way to the top. (Panel is supported until the last nut)
Place nuts and washers in a plastic bag/ container, and label with the loco number. (Very important as these are imperial and there may be no spares).
Mechanical

Remove nuts, starting from the bottom row, working your way to the top. (Panel is supported until the last nut)
Place nuts and washers in a plastic bag/ container, and label with the loco number. (Very important as these are imperial and there may be no spares).

cells.labelText: Remove the negative battery terminal

It is imperative that the negative terminal is disconnected first. (So a short circuit cannot be made later between positive and chassis with the spanner)
Using ½ inch geared spanners, remove nuts, bolts and washers from negative battery terminal first. 
Using a cable tie, secure the lug away from the battery terminal so they cannot accidentally touch.
Electrical

It is imperative that the negative terminal is disconnected first. (So a short circuit cannot be made later between positive and chassis with the spanner)
Using ½ inch geared spanners, remove nuts, bolts and washers from negative battery terminal first. 
Using a cable tie, secure the lug away from the battery terminal so they cannot accidentally touch.
Location:

Take Note:

cells.labelText: Remove the positive battery terminal

Disconnect positive terminal and secure the lug away from terminal using cable tie.
Store all nuts, bolts and washers in the same bag/ container as the cover panel nuts and washers.
Electrical

Disconnect positive terminal and secure the lug away from terminal using cable tie.
Store all nuts, bolts and washers in the same bag/ container as the cover panel nuts and washers.
Location:

Store all nuts, bolts and washers in the same bag/ container as the cover panel nuts and washers.

Take Note:
Store all nuts, bolts and washers in the same bag/ container as the cover panel nuts and washers
Notify QC agents 30 minutes before completion
